newsitem.title: USA: LVMH to acquire interest in DFS - NYT.
newsitem.headline: LVMH to acquire interest in DFS - NYT.

text.p: French luxury goods conglomerate LVMH Moet Hennessy-Louis Vuitton has signed an agreement to buy a controlling interest in DFS Group Ltd worth $2.47 billion, the New York Times reported on Wednesday.
But the newspaper said billionaire Robert Miller, who owns a 38.75-percent stake in the DFS empire of duty free stores, was trying to block the sale of the interest by his partners.
Miller has said the deal would violate the terms of an agreement he signed with his partners in 1991, it said.
